alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 26 at 1:27PM PDT until March 28 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT MONDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY TO 5 PM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 30 will result in frost formation. For the Wind Advisory, southerly winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 to 45 mph, locally up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the Sacramento Valley, Northeast Foothills and Motherlode. * WHEN...For the Frost Advisory, until 9 AM PDT Monday. For the Wind Advisory, from 5 PM Monday to 5 PM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Frost could kill sensitive outdoor vegetation if left uncovered. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Cold temperatures Monday morning will allow for areas of frost. Gusty southerly winds will develop Monday evening and persist into Tuesday. Strongest winds are expected Monday night through mid-day Tuesday, and in the northern Sacramento Valley and adjacent foothills.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
